result.execSummary:
The defendant Nathan V. Magnuson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Nathan V. Magnuson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Nathan V. Magnuson was found guilty of Possess w/ Intent-THC(>200-1000g), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)2.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution to victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

miscConds.notes: Allowed under the rules of the Sheriff.

Provide DNA sample.
Pay court financial obligations and supervision fees. 
Comply with treatment or programming directives to be determined by Agent.

timeConds.notes: furloughed from August 8, 2017 to August 23, 2017 at 10:00am. 14 days credit is from when he was picked up on July 26, 2017.

records.addlTxt: 3:54  Defendant Nathan V. Magnuson in court with attorney Donald J. Schwab.  Defendant Nathan V. Magnuson in custody.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Agent Drazkowski is present in the courtroom.  Froelich addresses the request - outlined in the letter by the agent.  Atty Schwab states that they are objecting to this.  Agent Sheila Drazkowski is sw and ex by Atty Schwab. Atty Froelich x-exams. Atty Schwab re-directs,  Atty Froelich re-exams .  Heather Holsclaw is sw and ex by Atty Schwab. Froelich re -x-exams. Froelich gives arguement. Schwab gives his arguement. The court orders:  60 days sanction.Credit for days served so far. Furloughed today until August 23, 2017 at 10:00 AM  Defendant must successfully completes the domestice violence class before he successfully completes probation.
from Probation and Parole Agent S Drazkowski asking for 60 days conditional jail time along with mandatory domestic violence programming.
Probation review hearing on August 8, 2017 at 03:00 pm.
Pierce County DNA Proof of Submission

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: 2:37 Defendant Nathan V. Magnuson in court with attorney Liesl E. Nelson.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Froelich and Nelson have both reviewed the PSI and have no corrections. Froelich: bound by PSI. Exh#1-photo of plants. Froelich gives sentencing argument; conditional jail time. Nelson gives sentencing argument; opposes conditionsl jail time. Court: S/W 3 years probation. conditions: court costs, DNA sample and surcharge, supervision fees, court obligation, complete conditions imposed by agent (see PSI),  30 days jail stayed until April 4, 2016 at 4pm huber allowed under the rules of the Sheriff.  Appeal rights are given to the defendant.
copy provided to Atty Froelich and Atty Nelson
copy provied to Atty Froelich and Atty Nelson

10:18 Defendant Nathan V. Magnuson in court with attorney Liesl E. Nelson.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Froelich Defendant will plead to count 2 requests PSI dismiss count 1, 3 and 4.   Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def.   Constitutional rights explained to defendant.   Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights.   DEF PLEADS GUILTY to count 2.   Facts are correct.   COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS.   The court finds the defendant guilty and adjudicates defendant guilty of count 2 of the information, counts 1, 3 and 4 dismissed.  Court orders PSI.  See Judicial Assistant for Sentencing date 60 days out.  Bond to continue, Judge reviews bond conditions with Defendant.

Final pre-trial at 12-01-2015 10:00 am.
Jury trial at 12-17-2015 08:30 am.
Information Filed with the Court and a copy is given to the defendant.   Charges read to the defendant.  Further reading waived.    DEF PLEADS NOT GUILTY TO ALL 4 CHARGES

9:38 am  
Defendant Nathan V. Magnuson in court with attorney Liesl E. Nelson.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Constitutional rights explained to defendant  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights.    Court accepts waiver of preliminary hearing and binds defendant over for further proceedings.  The court finds probable cause and binds defendant over for further proceedings.  Bond to remain as is.  Conditions reiterated to the defendant.  SEE JA for pretrial date.
Def voluntarily waives 20 day time limit for preliminary hearing
